Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Vase
Description: Rather tall goblet comprising a conical bottom where turning marks are still very visible. The body becomes more restricted towards the mouth and ends in a simple lip, common in the burials of the early New Kingdom. The goblet was wheel-turned and made of a common paste, fine but micaceous, from a Nile clay base that has been  smoothened and covered with a dark red wash.
